lessons.name: Pirsên Pêkan
lessons.subtitle: Comprehension Questions
lessons.learningObjective: Read the Sosîn & Delal story and answer comprehension questions identifying verbs and meaning

activities.example: Em li malê bi kurdî dipeyivin.

activities.instruction: Read the story of Sosîn and Delal
activities.title: Sosîn û Delal

lines.ku: Navê wê Sosîn e. Navê hevala wê Delal e.
lines.en: Her name is Sosîn. Her friend's name is Delal.

lines.ku: Sosîn sêvê davêje. Delal sêvê digire.
lines.en: Sosîn throws the apple. Delal catches the apple.

lines.speaker: Delal
lines.ku: Na, ez sêvê dixwim. Ez birçî me.
lines.en: No, I eat the apple. I am hungry.

activities.explanation: "Sosîn sêvê davêje" = Sosîn throws the apple. davêje = throws (from avêtin).
"Delal dikene" = Delal laughs. dikene = laughs (from kenîn).
Delal says "Ez birçî me" = I am hungry. That's why she eats the apple. birçî = hungry.

activities.instruction: Read the second dialogue about origins and occupations
activities.title: Ji ku yî? — Where are you from?

lines.speaker: A
lines.ku: Roj baş, tu ji ku yî?
lines.en: Good day, where are you from?

lines.speaker: B
lines.ku: Roj baş, ez ji Amedê me. Û tu?
lines.en: Good day, I am from Amed (Diyarbakir). And you?

lines.speaker: A
lines.ku: Ez ji Dêrsimê me. Tu kurd î?
lines.en: I am from Dersim. Are you Kurdish?

lines.speaker: B
lines.ku: Erê, ez kurd im. Hûn li malê bi kurdî dipeyivin?
lines.en: Yes, I am Kurdish. Do you speak Kurdish at home?

lines.speaker: A
lines.ku: Em zazakî dipeyivin. Ez kurdî nizanim.
lines.en: We speak Zazaki. I don't know Kurdish (Kurmanji).

lines.speaker: C
lines.ku: Roj baş! Ez ji kar têm. Hûn ji ku tên?
lines.en: Good day! I come from work. Where do you (pl.) come from?

lines.speaker: A
lines.ku: Em ji zanîngehê tên. Tu çi karî dikî?
lines.en: We come from the university. What is your job?

lines.speaker: C
lines.ku: Ez doktor im. Hûn çi karî dikin?
lines.en: I am a doctor. What are your jobs?

activities.instruction: Complete: Em li malê bi kurdî ___.
activities.explanation: For "em" (we), the verb peyivîn → dipeyivin. We speak Kurdish at home.

activities.instruction: Match each person with their occupation

lessons.name: Diyalog û Lêker
lessons.subtitle: Dialogue with Verb Identification
lessons.learningObjective: Read an annotated dialogue identifying which verb is used in each line, and learn new verbs: jenîn, hez kirin, firotin

activities.example: Ez ji muzîka kurdî hez dikim.

activities.translation: tembur — a traditional Kurdish long-necked lute

activities.instruction: Read the dialogue — notice which verb is used in each line
activities.title: Amûr û Muzîk — Instruments & Music

lines.speaker: B
lines.ku: Roj baş, ez baş im, spas. Û tu?
lines.en: Good day, I am good, thanks. And you? [bûn]

lines.speaker: A
lines.ku: Ez jî baş im, spas. Tu çi dikî?
lines.en: I am also good, thanks. What do you do? [kirin]

lines.speaker: A
lines.ku: Tu ji muzîka kurdî hez dikî?
lines.en: Do you like Kurdish music? [hez kirin]

lines.speaker: B
lines.ku: Ez ji muzîka kurdî hez dikim.

lines.speaker: B
lines.ku: Na, nan naxwim. Ez sêvê dixwim.
lines.en: No, I don't eat bread. I eat the apple. [xwarin]

lines.speaker: B
lines.ku: Ev pirtûk e. Tu pirtûkê dixwînî?
lines.en: This is a book. Do you read the book? [xwendin]

lines.speaker: A
lines.en: I don't know. I go home. [zanîn, çûn]

activities.explanation: B says "Ez amûran difroşim" and specifies "gîtar û tembûrê difroşim" — I sell guitars and temburs.
B says "Na, ez najenim" — No, I don't play. Even though B sells temburs, B does not play them.

activities.instruction: Complete: Ez ji muzîka kurdî hez ___.
activities.explanation: "hez kirin" = to like. For "ez" (I): hez dikim. The phrase uses "ji" before the thing you like: Ez ji ... hez dikim.
jenîn (to play music) → for "tu": dijenî. Tu tembûrê dijenî? = Do you play the tembur?

activities.instruction: Match the verb to what it means in this dialogue
